name: Answer the Question Quiz | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Steve Ditko.

	Steve Ditko also created Spider-Man for Marvel Comics, and originally made the Question for Charlton comics, whose heroes were later featured in DC's lineup.

questions.text: What is the Question's real name?
questions.explanation:
Charles Szasz.

	When he was still a character of Charlton Comics, The Question's alter ego was the investigative reporter Vic Sage, but DC later changed his real name to Charles Szasz.

questions.text: The Question learned martial arts from Lady Shiva.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Richard Dragon tutored the Question in martial arts and Eastern philosophy, not Lady Shiva. Shiva merely sent him to Dragon after The Question was severely beaten by Shiva in hand-to-hand combat.

questions.text: Which city did the Question call home?
questions.explanation:
Hub City.

	Writer Dennis O'Neil insisted that Hub City was based on a real American town, but refused to say which one. Hub City was a crime-ridden locale run by corrupt politicians.

questions.text: Myra Fermin was The Question's love interest.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Myra Fermin was elected mayor of Hub City, only to be shot by her husband Wesley because he felt she held Communist beliefs. This put her into a coma, and Hub City fell into chaos.

questions.text: The Question covers his features with a material called pseudoderm. Who invented pseudoderm?
questions.explanation:
Aristotle Rodor.

	"Tot" Rodor served as the Question's mentor and it was this relationship that was one of the positive aspects of the Question's life.

questions.text: When Batman left Gotham City for a year, the Question took over as the city's protector.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The Question teams up with Renee Montoya, an ex-policewoman, to protect the city. During this time he fights against Intergang and meets the new Batwoman. However, Batman appoints Two-Face as Gotham's protector in his absence.

questions.text: Where does the Question travel to further investigate Intergang?
questions.explanation:
Khandaq.

	Khandaq is home to Black Adam, Isis and Osiris. They helped the Question and Montoya to infiltrate and take down Intergang. Question and Montoya were awarded a medal for their help.

questions.text: What kind of cancer does the Question suffer from?
questions.explanation:
Lung Cancer.

	Charles Szasz suffers from lung cancer, with Montoya acting as his nurse. It is one of the most deadly cancers, killing about 3 million people annually.

questions.text: On New Year's Eve, the Question sang "Danny Boy".
questions.explanation:
True.

	"Danny Boy" is a love song written by Frederick Weatherly in 1910. It is widely considered an Irish anthem, even though Weatherly was not Irish.
